ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Fletchers] HELP!
ygData.msgSnippet: Ouch, I have a friend who is a jeweler.  He has experienced the same symptoms. Around 185 or so he suddenly stopped going up in skill.  In the past 6 months he
ygData.messageBody:
Ouch,

I have a friend who is a jeweler. He has experienced the same symptoms.
Around 185 or so he suddenly stopped going up in skill. In the past 6
months he has gone up something like 3 points, and he makes lots of jewelry
(he enjoys being a merchant). Not sure if this is applicable to fletching
but interesting none the less.

Seneca


----Original Message Follows----
From: kishuarashi@...
Reply-To: EQ_Fletchers@egroups.com
To: EQ_Fletchers@egroups.com
Subject: [EQ_Fletchers] HELP!
Date: Thu, 17 Aug 2000 05:20:45 -0000

Geez, I hate to sound so desperate ... but I kind of am. Okay,
I was fletching today ::the crowd gasps:: :). I was at 185 working
on ceramic vane arrows and everything was going fine ... until I hit
189. Then my skill increases just STOPPED. I fletched 3 whole
backpacks of components without a single increase, and the arrows
weren't trivial yet. So I decided to try the next component up,
which is steel shafts. Fletched 2 backpacks of those and still
nothing. I then asked another fletcher what I should do and they
said try using small nocks, steel shafts, silver tipped points, and
ceramic vanes. I did ... bought 2 backpacks worth (ouch), and STILL
no increase. So my question is ... what do I do now? I've now used
up 7 backpacks of components without 1 increase ... does it just take
this long to increase your skill at this point ::prays to every god
in Norrath that isn't so::? Is there something else I should be
doing? Or am I just having a bad EQ day (very possible there)? Any
suggestions that would ease the fears of this poor, frustrated wood
elf would be greatly appreciated :).

Tira Misu of Lanys T'vyl
